Novelty

This is the first known integration of DQN + PPO with a virtual navigator model for drone
swarm patrolling in real agricultural terrains. Its multi-layer control framework (integrating Pl
loops, PXé4 flight stack, and bio-inspired swarming dynamics) represents a significant
advancement for scalable, real-time drone swarm coordination in unstructured
environments.

1.9. AUAV Patrol System Using Panoramic Stitching and Object
Detection

November 2019

Journal :Computers & Electrical Engineering
Publisher: Elsevier

Google Scholar Link

Summary

This paper presents a UAV-based patrol system that addresses two key challenges in drone
surveillance: how to create a complete view of the monitored area, and how to detect important
objects within that view. The system first generates a stitched panoramic image from drone
video footage using SPHP and a region-growing algorithm that reduces motion ghosting. It then
applies Faster R-CNN for object detection, enhanced using scene classification and parsing,
allowing for more accurate bounding box predictions. Evaluations on the VisDrone ECCV 2018
dataset demonstrate that this two-stage system produces high-quality panoramic views and
improved detection accuracy.

Highlight

The key strength of this paper lies in its combination of panoramic video stitching and
deep-learning-based object detection, which provides both situational awareness and tactical
precision in surveillance. The use of scene-aware scoring refinement improves detection
beyond raw neural outputs, offering better performance in cluttered or complex drone footage.
